title: Authors and Citation
text: Larrode M (2023). packageSolidaire: Companion L'Equipage Solidaire data. R package version 0.1.0, https://matteolarrode.github.io/packageSolidaire/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {packageSolidaire: Companion for L'Equipage Solidaire data},   author = {Matteo Larrode},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://matteolarrode.github.io/packageSolidaire/}, }

title: Companion for L'Equipage Solidaire data
text: {packageSolidaire} companion staff L’Equipage Solidaire Delivraide work orders data mobile application. includes two main set functions: functions clean, pre-process, group datasets cities delivery dates; functions plot map orders using visual identity L’Equipage Solidaire.

title: Companion for L'Equipage Solidaire data
text: can install development version packageSolidaire GitHub :

title: Count orders by city — count_orders_city
text: df dataframe Delivraide orders city column city name (default: city). Note: add quotes around column name.

title: Count orders by city — count_orders_city
code: #' # Load the sample orders data data(sample_orders_data)  # Group and count orders per department dpt_orders <- count_orders_city(sample_orders_data) #> Error in mutate(summarise(group_by(df, city), city_orders = n()), perc = scales::percent(city_orders/sum(city_orders),     accuracy = 0.1, trim = FALSE)): ℹ In argument: `perc = scales::percent(...)`. #> Caused by error in `loadNamespace()`: #> ! there is no package called ‘scales’

title: Count orders by department — count_orders_dpt
text: Groups counts orders dataset department, using zip codes.

title: Count orders by department — count_orders_dpt
text: df dataframe Delivraide orders zip column zip code (default: zip). Note: add quotes around column name.

title: Count orders by department — count_orders_dpt
code: #' # Load the sample orders data data(sample_orders_data)  # Group and count orders per department dpt_orders <- count_orders_dpt(sample_orders_data) #> Error in mutate(filter(summarise(group_by(mutate(filter(df, !is.na(zip),     nchar(as.character(zip)) == 5), departement = str_sub(as.character(zip),     start = 1, end = 2)), departement), dpt_orders = n()), departement !=     "0."), perc = scales::percent(dpt_orders/sum(dpt_orders),     accuracy = 0.1, trim = FALSE)): ℹ In argument: `perc = scales::percent(dpt_orders/sum(dpt_orders), #>   accuracy = 0.1, trim = FALSE)`. #> Caused by error in `loadNamespace()`: #> ! there is no package called ‘scales’

title: Create waiting days variable — create_waiting_days_var
text: Creates "waiting days" variable computing difference date order created, date delivered.

title: Create waiting days variable — create_waiting_days_var
text: df dataframe Delivraide deliveries. creat_date name column representing order creation date (default: createdAt). Must date date-time format, string. deliv_date name column representing order delivery date (default: updatedAt). Must date date-time format, string.

title: Create waiting days variable — create_waiting_days_var
text: dataframe additional column "waiting_days" representing waiting time days.

title: Create waiting days variable — create_waiting_days_var
code: # Load the sample orders data data(sample_orders_data)  # Filter delivered orders delivered_orders <- filter_delivered(sample_orders_data)  # Add waiting days variable delivered_orders_new <- create_waiting_days_var(delivered_orders)  # You can also use pipes: delivered_orders_new2 <- delivered_orders |>   create_waiting_days_var()

title: Filter delivered kits — filter_delivered
text: Filters dataset orders delivered, removes cancelled.   using specified tracking variable, defaulting "tracking_status", present Delivraide data.

title: Filter delivered kits — filter_delivered
text: df dataframe Delivraide orders col_name column use filtering (default: tracking_status). Note: add quotes around column name.

title: Filter delivered kits — filter_delivered
text: input dataframe filtered include orders delivered.

title: Filter delivered kits — filter_delivered
code: # Load the sample orders data data(sample_orders_data)  # Filter the delivered orders delivered_orders <- filter_delivered(sample_orders_data)

what: Sample Data of Orders on the Deliveraide Mobile Application — sample_orders_data
title: Sample Data of Orders on the Deliveraide Mobile Application — sample_orders_data
text: tibble containing 20 sample orders format data exported mobile application. data can used testing running examples. variables follows:

title: Sample Data of Orders on the Deliveraide Mobile Application — sample_orders_data
Sample Data of Orders on the Deliveraide Mobile Application — sample_orders_data
text: tibble 20 rows 17 variables: city Name city order placed zip ZIP code city order placed meat Indicator whether order includes meat (1 = includes meat, 0 = include meat) fish Indicator whether order includes fish (1 = includes fish, 0 = include fish) porc Indicator whether order includes pork (1 = includes pork, 0 = include pork) is_completed Indicator whether order completed (1 = completed, 0 = completed) tracking_status Status order tracking (0 = yet accepted, 1 = waiting time slot, 2 = time slot convened courier, 3 = delivered) createdAt Date time order created updatedAt Date time order last updated (tracking_status == 3, date time kit delivered) date_accepted Date time order accepted date_request Date time order request made priority_score Priority score assigned beneficiary is_alone Indicator whether beneficiary lives alone (1 = alone, 0 = alone) is_apl Indicator whether beneficiary earns APL (1 = APL, 0 = APL) is_boursier Indicator whether beneficiary scholarship recipient (1 = boursier, 0 = boursier) is_handicap Indicator whether beneficiary disability (1 = disability, 0 = disability) is_winning Indicator whether beneficiary active workforce (1 = winning, 0 = winning)
